item.title: James add a quote by William Shakespeare
item.description: "The fool doth think he is wise, but the wise man knows himself to be a fool." -- William Shakespeare

item.title: James add a quote by William Gibson
item.description: "The sky above the port was the color of television, tuned to a dead channel." -- William Gibson

item.title: James add a quote by William Gibson
item.description: "The street finds its own uses for things." -- William Gibson

item.title: James add a quote by William Gibson
item.description: "Cyberspace. A consensual hallucination experienced daily by billions of legitimate operators, in every nation, by children being taught mathematical concepts... A graphic representation of data abstracted from banks of every computer in the human system. Unthinkable complexity. Lines of light ranged in the nonspace of the mind, clusters and constellations of data. Like city lights, receding..." -- William Gibson

item.title: James add a quote by William Gibson
item.description: "All the speed he took, all the turns he'd taken and the corners he'd cut in Night City, and still he'd see the matrix in his sleep, bright lattices of logic unfolding across that colorless void..." -- William Gibson

item.title: James add a quote by William Gibson
item.description: "The deadliest bullshit is odorless, and transparent." -- William Gibson

item.title: James add a quote by William Gibson
item.description: "Secrets...are the very root of cool." -- William Gibson
